p: Forecasting disease dynamics are useful in a number of settings. This includes: planning to handle surge in hospital admissions (health care workers, protective equipment, ventilators, etc.), planning and producing pharmaceuticals, including vaccines and antivirals, taking precautionary measures such closing schools and community activities. For instance, during the 2009 H1N1 pandemic, forecasting was used for taking certain actions that included school closures in NYC. During the 2014 Ebola outbreak in West Africa, forecasts played an important role in galvanizing an international response to the outbreak. See [ 62, 63] for more information and discussion on this topic.
